memberdef.name: copy_prop_value
memberdef.initializer: length_part = strlen(value_part); \ if (value_part + length_part < (value_all + length_all) && \ length_part > 0) \ names.to = value_part; \ value_part += length_part + 1;

memberdef.argsstring: (struct x11_backend *b, struct x11_output *output, int width, int height)
memberdef.name: x11_output_init_shm

detaileddescription.para: If we don't have XCB-XKB bindings, the best we can do (given that XCB also lacks XI2 support), is to take the state from the core key events. Unfortunately that only gives us the effective (i.e. union of depressed/latched/locked) state, and we need the granularity.
So we still update the state with every key event we see, but also use the state field from X11 events as a mask so we don't get any stuck modifiers.
